Transformation of Gibbs samples

transform_gibbs_samples.Rd

Function that normalizes, burns and thins the Gibbs samples.

transform_gibbs_samples(gibbs_samples, R, B, Q, scale)

Arguments

gibbs_samples

The output of gibbs_sampling, i.e. a list of Gibbs samples.
R

The number of iterations of the Gibbs sampler.
B

The length of the burn-in period, i.e. a non-negative number of samples to be discarded.
Q

The thinning factor for the Gibbs samples, i.e. only every Qth sample is kept.
scale

A named list of three elements, determining the parameter normalization with respect to the utility scale:

  • parameter: Either "a" (for a linear coefficient of "alpha") or "s" (for a variance of the error-term covariance matrix "Sigma").

  • index: The index of the parameter that gets fixed.

  • value: The value for the fixed parameter.

Value

A list of transformed Gibbs samples. Each element is a list, containing the Gibbs samples for s, alpha, b, Omega, and Sigma (if available):

  • gibbs_samples: The function input gibbs_samples

  • gibbs_samples_n: A list of normalized samples based on scale

  • gibbs_samples_nb: A list of normalized and burned samples based on scale and B

  • gibbs_samples_nt: A list of normalized and thinned samples based on scale and Q

  • gibbs_samples_nbt: A list of normalized, burned and thinned samples based on scale, B and Q

Contents
